stories.original_headline: New research shows emotional expressions work differently in autism
stories.original_summary: Researchers found that autistic and non-autistic people move their faces differently when expressing emotions like anger, happiness, and sadness. Autistic participants tended to rely on different facial features and produced more varied expressions, which can look unfamiliar to non-autistic observer
stories.fantasy_headline: Sages Uncover Diverse Ways of Showing Feeling
stories.fantasy_story: Scholars and wizards have observed that folk from the Enchanted Meadows express joy or sorrow with varied gestures. Some use their countenances in unique ways, different from others, which can sometimes lead to confusion amongst the populace.

stories.original_headline: Threads overtakes X on mobile, but still lags far behind
stories.original_summary: After launching almost three years ago, Meta's Threads is now reportedly attracting more daily mobile users than rival platform X. According to Similarweb data shared by TechCrunch, Threads has 141.5 million daily active iOS and Android global app users as of January 7th, compared to 125 million use
stories.fantasy_headline: The Weaving Spells Guild Draws More Eyes Than Its Rival
stories.fantasy_story: The Weaving Spells Guild, which creates enchanted scrolls for sharing thoughts, now sees more daily gazers than the X-Marked Scribes' Cartel. Though it has gathered many new followers, it still strives to match the ancient reach of its elder competitor.

stories.original_headline: You need to listen to the cosmic horror-comedy podcast Welcome to Night Vale
stories.original_summary: It's relatively rare for a podcast to last 14 years, especially a fiction one. In fact, as far as I can tell, Welcome to Night Vale is the longest continually running fiction podcast out there. (Some will argue it's actually We're Alive, but that has taken a few significant breaks between seasons.)
stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Bardic Story-Spell Continues Its Long Run
stories.fantasy_story: A most enduring tale, shared through enchanted listening stones, has captivated listeners for fourteen years! This unique story-spell, known as "Welcome to Night Vale," continues to weave its strange blend of unsettling wonders and jests, making it the longest-running of its kind.
